body.p:
Munfordville Ky 13th April 61
To the Governor of Kentucky

Two Judgts have Just been rendered by the Hart Equity & criminal Court, in favor of the Comth, one agst H H Lock, The other agst N Goldsmith for fifty Dollars each, under Indictments charging them respectively with Selling Spiritous liquor to minors, The evidence in each case showed that the offences were committed during last Summer, soon after the law under which the Indictments were found went into operation, and the sales were made to a young man who might reasonably be supposed, to be of age,
The proof in the case while it showed an actual violation of law, did not clearly show an Intentional violation
Under the circumstances I am Satisfied that it would be Just & proper for you to remit Said fines, So far as the Executive has the power to remit
Wm B Jones atty for the Comth

Letter of W. B. Jones
Commonwealths attorney to Govenor to remit fine of Lock & Goldsmith
